original_text:
LC Series - Liquid Level Sensors (Optical Switches)

LC-PS Family - Standard Pressure Optical Switch (46 bar)
Technology: Infrared optical detection, digital ON/OFF output

Model Variants:
- LC-PS Cable (3-wire pre-wired cable) - Standard installation
- LC-XT M12 (M12 industrial connector) - Same as LC-PS with removable connector for easier maintenance

Technical Specifications:
- Maximum pressure: 46 bar
- Compatible refrigerants: HFC, HFO, R134a, R404A, R410A
- Universal output: NPN/PNP/AC in single model
- Protection: IP67
- Operating temperature: -40¬∞C to +125¬∞C
- Response time: Instantaneous (<1 second)

LC-PH Family - High Pressure Optical Switch (120 bar)
Technology: Infrared optical with reinforced structural design

Model Variants:
- LC-PH Cable (3-wire cable) - 120 bar for CO2 transcritical
- LC-XP M12 (M12 connector) - 120 bar industrial connector version

Technical Specifications:
- Maximum pressure: 120 bar (for CO2 transcritical)
- Compatible refrigerants: CO2 (R744), HFC, HFO, high-pressure applications
- Reinforced body for extreme mechanical/thermal stress
- Same universal output as LC-PS
- Rotalock adapter compatibility

When to Choose:
- LC-PS/XT: Pressure ‚â§46 bar, standard refrigeration (HFC/HFO)
- LC-PH/XP: Pressure >46 bar up to 120 bar, CO2 transcritical systems (mandatory)
- XT/XP variants: Choose M12 connector for easier maintenance and replacement

[Product Matrix] - LC Series Level Sensors - Optical switches with 2 pressure families (46 bar and 120 bar)

Question: What LC sensors do you offer?

Respond as an expert Teklab technical sales assistant with accurate product specifications.

Teklab offers 2 LC sensor families: LC-PS/XT for standard pressure (46 bar) with HFC/HFO refrigerants, and LC-PH/XP for high pressure (120 bar) including CO2 transcritical systems. Each family comes with cable or M12 connector variants.

metadata.chunk_title: Product Matrix - LC Series Level Sensors
key_concepts: LC-PS and LC-XT for 46 bar standard pressure
LC-PH and LC-XP for 120 bar CO2 transcritical
Universal NPN/PNP/AC output in single model
M12 connector variants for easier maintenance
Instantaneous response time with IR optical technology
iconic_quotes: LC-PS and LC-XT are functionally identical - the only difference is connector type (cable vs M12)
For CO2 transcritical systems, LC-PH or LC-XP with 120 bar rating is mandatory
M12 connector variants (LC-XT, LC-XP) offer easier maintenance and faster replacement
Universal output means one model works with NPN, PNP, or AC - no need for multiple SKUs

qa_pairs.question: What's the difference between LC-PS and LC-XT?
qa_pairs.answer: LC-PS and LC-XT are functionally identical sensors rated for 46 bar. The only difference is the connector: LC-PS has a pre-wired 3-wire cable, while LC-XT has an M12 industrial connector for easier maintenance and replacement.

qa_pairs.question: Which LC sensor should I use for CO2 transcritical systems?
qa_pairs.answer: For CO2 transcritical systems, you must use LC-PH or LC-XP, which are rated for 120 bar maximum pressure. These models have reinforced construction to handle the extreme pressures found in R744 transcritical applications. LC-PS/XT (46 bar) are not suitable.

qa_pairs.question: What does universal output mean for LC sensors?
qa_pairs.answer: Universal output means the LC sensor can work with NPN, PNP, or AC signals in a single model. You don't need to order different versions for different PLC types - one part number works with all, reducing BOM complexity and inventory.

qa_pairs.question: When should I choose M12 connector variants (LC-XT or LC-XP)?
qa_pairs.answer: Choose M12 connector variants when you need easier maintenance, faster sensor replacement, or modular installation. The removable industrial connector (EN 175301-803A standard) allows quick disconnect without cutting cables, ideal for frequent maintenance or OEM applications.
